data.text: @AmegoRica @diffie12 You didn’t. Take a look at Dr John Campbells video on YouTube covering this exact topic

@RonaldTrouble They redacted that info so the 2.9% is % the deaths from adverse reactions reported, 42,000 ppl. We don’t get to know how many people participated in this specific study because they don’t want us to know the real death rate.

@Anna60282244 @AmegoRica redacted.  They did not quote the total number of doses given - which makes this op statement wrong.  We have no idea what % of those taking it had adverse reaction.  They should have released.  I know as of Feb 21, more than 200M doses had been given world wide
@AmegoRica How do you get the 2.9%.  They did not release the total number of doses.  By feb 2021 (150M) almost 55% of Americans already had one dose.
@meredithmusing @AmegoRica @Russ_Warrior Yes, I think you may be right. The trial participants skewed younger.

@gsendit_m @jblelgin @AmegoRica And I personally do not know a single person that was harmed from the vaccine. However, I do know people that have died and/or have family members currently fighting for their lives due to covid.
@torontosinan I was meaning to reply to the other person. Lol

@diffie12 @AmegoRica Oh thank you, I actually didn't deny what you are posting...

my comment was a play on "died with covid", which we now know a huge number of deaths were not outright caused by covid, just a contributor.
@TheresaDianeUK1 @AmegoRica @respect65 No, it didn’t. That’s a made-up number.
@EmpireinWinter @AmegoRica @Russ_Warrior Uh, no, this was post-authorisation, so it includes the first people to be getting vaccinated, which would skew much older.
